verses.verse: Woe <S%H1945><s%> to you, O destroyer, <S%H7703><s%> While you were not destroyed; <S%H7703><s%> And he who is treacherous, <S%H898><s%> while [others] did not deal <S%H898><s%> treacherously <S%H898><s%> with him. As soon as you shall finish <S%H8552><s%> destroying, <S%H7703><s%> you shall be destroyed; <S%H7703><s%> As soon as you shall cease <S%H5239><s%> to deal <S%H898><s%> treacherously, <S%H898><s%> [others] shall deal <S%H898><s%> treacherously <S%H898><s%> with you.

O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to us; we have waited <S%H6960><s%> for Thee. Be Thou their strength <S%H2220><s%> every morning, <S%H1242><s%> Our salvation <S%H3444><s%> also <S%H637><s%> in the time <S%H6256><s%> of distress. <S%H6869><s%>
At the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the tumult <S%H1995><s%> peoples <S%H5971><s%> flee; <S%H5074><s%> At the lifting <S%H7427><s%> up of Thyself nations <S%H1471><s%> disperse. <S%H9339><s%>

And your spoil <S%H7998><s%> is gathered <S%H622><s%> [as] the caterpillar <S%H2625><s%> gathers; <S%H625><s%> As locusts <S%H9069><s%> rushing <S%H4944><s%> about, <S%H4944><s%> men rush <S%H8264><s%> about <S%H8264><s%> on it.

The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is exalted, <S%H7682><s%> for He dwells <S%H7931><s%> on high; <S%H4791><s%> He has filled <S%H4390><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%> with justice <S%H4941><s%> and righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

And He shall be the stability <S%H530><s%> of your times, <S%H6256><s%> A wealth <S%H2633><s%> of salvation, <S%H3444><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge; <S%H1847><s%> The fear <S%H3374><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is his treasure. <S%H214><s%>

Behold, <S%H2005><s%> their brave <S%H691><s%> men <S%H691><s%> cry <S%H6817><s%> in the streets, <S%H2351><s%> The ambassadors <S%H4397><s%> of peace <S%H7965><s%> weep <S%H1058><s%> bitterly. <S%H4751><s%>

The highways <S%H4546><s%> are desolate, <S%H8074><s%> the traveler <S%H5674><s%> has ceased, <S%H7673><s%> He has broken <S%H6565><s%> the covenant, <S%H1285><s%> he has despised <S%H3988><s%> the cities, <S%H5892><s%> He has no <S%H3808><s%> regard <S%H2803><s%> for man. <S%H582><s%>

The land <S%H776><s%> mourns <S%H56><s%> and pines <S%H535><s%> away, <S%H535><s%> Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> is shamed <S%H2659><s%> and withers; <S%H7060><s%> Sharon <S%H8289><s%> is like a desert <S%H6160><s%> plain, <S%H6160><s%> And Bashan <S%H1316><s%> and Carmel <S%H3760><s%> lose <S%H5287><s%> [their foliage.]
"Now <S%H6258><s%> I will arise, <S%H6965><s%>" says <S%H559><s%> the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> "Now <S%H6258><s%> I will be exalted, <S%H7426><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> I will be lifted <S%H5375><s%> up.

"You have conceived <S%H2029><s%> chaff, <S%H2842><s%> you will give <S%H3205><s%> birth <S%H3205><s%> to stubble; <S%H7179><s%> My breath <S%H7307><s%> will consume <S%H398><s%> you like a fire. <S%H784><s%>
"And the peoples <S%H5971><s%> will be burned <S%H4955><s%> to lime, <S%H7875><s%> Like cut <S%H3683><s%> thorns <S%H6975><s%> which are burned <S%H3341><s%> in the fire. <S%H784><s%>

"You who <S%H7350><s%> are far <S%H7350><s%> away, <S%H7350><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> what <S%H834><s%> I have done; <S%H6213><s%> And you who <S%H7138><s%> are near, <S%H7138><s%> acknowledge <S%H3045><s%> My might. <S%H1369><s%>"

Sinners <S%H2400><s%> in Zion <S%H6726><s%> are terrified; <S%H6342><s%> Trembling <S%H9564><s%> has seized <S%H270><s%> the godless. <S%H2611><s%> "Who <S%H4310><s%> among us can live <S%H1481><s%> with the consuming <S%H398><s%> fire <S%H784><s%>? Who <S%H4310><s%> among us can live <S%H1481><s%> with continual <S%H5769><s%> burning <S%H4168><s%>?"

He who walks <S%H1980><s%> righteously, <S%H6666><s%> and speaks <S%H1696><s%> with sincerity, <S%H4339><s%> He who rejects <S%H3988><s%> unjust <S%H1215><s%> <S%H4642><s%> gain, <S%H1215><s%> And shakes <S%H5287><s%> his hands <S%H3709><s%> so <S%H4480><s%> that they hold <S%H8551><s%> no <S%H4480><s%> bribe; <S%H7810><s%> He who stops <S%H331><s%> his ears <S%H241><s%> from hearing <S%H8085><s%> about bloodshed, <S%H1818><s%> And shuts <S%H9429><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> from looking <S%H7200><s%> upon evil; <S%H9563><s%>

He will dwell <S%H7931><s%> on the heights; <S%H4791><s%> His refuge <S%H4869><s%> will be the impregnable <S%H4679><s%> rock; <S%H5553><s%> His bread <S%H3899><s%> will be given <S%H5414><s%> [him;] His water <S%H4325><s%> will be sure. <S%H539><s%>
Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> will see <S%H2372><s%> the King <S%H4428><s%> in His beauty; <S%H3308><s%> They will behold <S%H7200><s%> a far-distant land. <S%H776><s%>

Your heart <S%H3820><s%> will meditate <S%H1897><s%> on terror: <S%H367><s%> "Where <S%H346><s%> is he who counts <S%H5608><s%>? Where <S%H346><s%> is he who weighs <S%H8254><s%>? Where <S%H346><s%> is he who counts <S%H5608><s%> the towers <S%H4026><s%>?"

You will no <S%H3808><s%> longer see <S%H7200><s%> a fierce <S%H3267><s%> people, <S%H5971><s%> A people <S%H5971><s%> of unintelligible <S%H6012><s%> speech <S%H8193><s%> which no <S%H4480><s%> one comprehends, <S%H8085><s%> Of a stammering <S%H3932><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> which no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> understands. <S%H998><s%>

Look <S%H2372><s%> upon Zion, <S%H6726><s%> the city <S%H7151><s%> of our appointed <S%H4150><s%> feasts; <S%H4150><s%> Your eyes <S%H5869><s%> shall see <S%H7200><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> an undisturbed <S%H7600><s%> habitation, <S%H5116><s%> A tent <S%H168><s%> which shall not be folded, <S%H6813><s%> Its stakes <S%H3489><s%> shall never <S%H1077><s%> <S%H5331><s%> be pulled <S%H5265><s%> up Nor <S%H1077><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> of its cords <S%H9112><s%> be torn <S%H5423><s%> apart. <S%H5423><s%>

But there <S%H8033><s%> the majestic <S%H117><s%> [One,] the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> shall be for us A place <S%H4725><s%> of rivers <S%H5104><s%> [and] wide <S%H7342><s%> canals, <S%H2975><s%> On which no <S%H1077><s%> boat <S%H590><s%> with oars <S%H7885><s%> shall go, <S%H1980><s%> And on which no <S%H3808><s%> mighty <S%H117><s%> ship <S%H6716><s%> shall pass <S%H5674><s%> –
For the Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our judge, <S%H8199><s%> The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our lawgiver, <S%H2710><s%> The Lord <S%H3068><s%> is our king; <S%H4428><s%> He will save <S%H3467><s%> us –

Your tackle <S%H9112><s%> hangs <S%H5203><s%> slack; <S%H5203><s%> It cannot <S%H1077><s%> hold <S%H2388><s%> the base <S%H3653><s%> of its mast <S%H8650><s%> firmly, <S%H2388><s%> Nor <S%H1077><s%> spread <S%H6566><s%> out the sail. <S%H5251><s%> Then <S%H227><s%> the prey <S%H5706><s%> of an abundant <S%H4766><s%> spoil <S%H7998><s%> will be divided; <S%H2505><s%> The lame <S%H6455><s%> will take <S%H962><s%> the plunder. <S%H957><s%>

And no <S%H1077><s%> resident <S%H7934><s%> will say, <S%H559><s%> "I am sick <S%H2470><s%>"; The people <S%H5971><s%> who dwell <S%H3427><s%> there will be forgiven <S%H5375><s%> [their] iniquity. <S%H5771><s%>
